alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Slow moving thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Moffat County through 615 PM MDT... At 540 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking slow moving thunderstorms near Craig, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain may lead to localized flooding. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Moffat County. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 80 and 100. Colorado 13 between mile markers 83 and 104. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
